member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.TilesPanelBase.GetExplicitLayoutTileSizeBehavior
member.summary: Determines whether tile heights are synchronized across columns and whether tile widths are synchronized across rows when is set to 'UseExplicitRowColumnOnTile'

remarks.para: If there are ColumnsSpan values specified > 1 on one or more tiles then all tiles in intersecting columns will behave as if this setting was 'SynchronizeTileWidthsAndHeights' with respect to all other tiles in those intersecting columns.

Likewise, if there are RowSpan values specified > 1 on one or more tiles then all tiles in intersecting rows will behave as if this setting was 'SynchronizeTileWidthsAndHeights' with respect to all other tiles in those intersecting rows.

Note: regardless of the value of this setting if the overall size is constrained (e.g. if the HorizontalTileAreaAlignment and/or VerticalTileAreaAlignment is set to 'Stretch') then resizing a tile's width may indirectly affect the width of all tiles and resizing its height may indirectly affect the height of all tiles respectively.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.TilesPanelBase.GetExplicitMinimizedAreaExtent
member.summary: Gets an explicit extent for the minimized tile area
member.returns: An value that represents the width of the minimized area in maximized mode when MaximizedTileLocation is 'Left' or 'Right'. When MaximizedTileLocation is 'Top' or 'Bottom', it represents the height.

remarks.para: Note: if this method returns the default value of 0 then the indivdual tile preferred sizes will be used to determine the extent of this area.

This is a convenient place for derived classes to cleanup a ToolTip previously created in OnDeferredScrollingStarted.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Internal.XmlNodePropertyDescriptorProvider.MergePropertiesFromNode(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Merges properties from the passed in node to the exiisting set of properties.

remarks.para: Since each node doesn't necessarily contain all of the possible attributes and child nodes that can make up its set of properties we want to add new properties as we encounter nodes.
Note: if properties are added then the event will be raised.

member.param: The node whose properties will be merged.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.PrimitivesBrushKeys
member.summary: Static class that exposes the resource keys used by the elements in the assembly.

remarks.para: These keys are referenced in the templates of the elements defined within the assembly via dynamic references. Therefore, the default brushes can be easily changed by defining replacement brushes, keyed with these keys, in resources anywhere within the resolution scope of their use.
Note: These brushes are normally added to the Resources collection of the window or the application.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for reporting.

remarks.p: The class exposes properties that determine the default settings for the report.
remarks.para: Note: the derived class, Report, is in the Infragistics.Wpf.Reporting assembly, and it exposes a collection of s which surface additional properties that can be used to override the defaults specified here.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportBase.PageImageableAreaExtent
member.summary: The size of the imageable area that the printer will support.

remarks.para: Note: this value is only valid during a report generation or export operation. Also it doesn't take into account the page orientation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportBase.PageOrigin
member.summary: The origin of the page i.e. offset to allow for the capabilities of the printer.

remarks.para: Note: this value is only valid during a report generation or export operation. Also it doesn't take into account the page orientation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the style for the ReportPagePresenter

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportBase.PageSizeResolved
member.summary: The actual size of the page used during a report generation or export operation (read-only).

remarks.para: Note: this value is only valid during a report generation or export operation. Also it doesn't take into account the page orientation.

member.summary: Gets the object that contains the settings for the entire Report (read-only)

remarks.p: This is an abstract property and must be overriden in derived classes to provide the settings object for report.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator
member.summary: Interface implemented by embedded visual elements within a that need to alter their visual tree in response to pagination in the containing .

remarks.para: Note: This interface, or the interface, is implemented by controls that may represent multiple pages of data, e.g. XamDateGrid. The interface is used by the EmbeddedVisualReportSection, found in the Infragistic.Wpf.Reporting assembly, to generate all of the appropriate pages.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator.BeginPagination(Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSection)
member.summary: Called when a pagination process is about to begin.
member.param: The section of the report.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator.EndPagination
member.summary: Called when the pagination has ended.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator.MoveToNextPage
member.summary: Requests that the implementor move to the next page and update its visual tree if necessary..
member.returns: True if the implementor was able to move to the next page, or false if there was no next page.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator.MoveToPosition(Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.PagePosition)
member.summary: Requests that the implementor move to a specific page represented by the supplied and update its visual tree if necessary.
member.param: A instance that represents the page to move to.
member.returns: True if the implementor was able to move to the requested page, or false if the move failed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator.CurrentPageDataContext
member.summary: Returns a piece of opaque data that will be set as the DataContext on the root visual of a Report's current page.
member.value: The current page's data context or null if there is no data context for the current page.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator.CurrentPagePosition
member.summary: Returns a PagePosition instance that represents the current page position in the embedded visual (read-only).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator.EstimatedPageCount
member.summary: Returns the estimated count of page that will be printed (read-only).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator.LogicalPageNumber
member.summary: Returns an integer that indicates the logical row of the current page (read-only).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginator.LogicalPagePartNumber
member.summary: Returns an integer that indicates the logical column of the current page(read-only).

remarks.para: Note: when the is set to 'Scale', this property will return 1.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginatorFactory
member.summary: Interface implemented by a control that can create an element that implements the interface.

remarks.p: A control that implements this interface, e.g. a XamDataGrid, can be passed into the constructor of an EmbeddedVisualReportSection, defined in the Infragistics.Wpf.Reporting assembly, which will then drive the pagination logic.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.IEmbeddedVisualPaginatorFactory.Create
member.summary: Creates an instance of an element that implemets the interface.
member.returns: A instance of a visual that implements the interface.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.PagePosition
member.summary: Base class for storing position information during pagination.

remarks.para: Note: other than the 3 special PagePosition instances, , and , these objects are normally instances of derived classes that maintain state information that is only relevant to the implementor of the associated interface. In other words, it is opaque to the driving logic.

member.summary: Static read-only property that returns an instance of a PagePosition that represents an invalid page.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSection
member.summary: Abstract base class that represents a section in a report.

remarks.p: The class exposes properties that relate to a specific section in a report and are used to override any report-wide default settings specified on the .
remarks.para: The Report class, derived from , is in the Infragistics.Wpf.Reporting assembly and it exposes a collection of ReportSections. Each section can represent 1 or more pages in the report. For example the derived class EmbeddedVisualReportSection, also in the Infragistics.Wpf.Reporting assembly, will accept in its constructor an element that implements either the or interface to support printing multiple pages. This is how the XamDataGrid supports printing.

Note: each section in the report starts on a new page. For example, if you created a Report with 3 EmbeddedVisualReportSections, one with a XamDataGrid and 2 others with simple elements, each section would start on a new page even though there might have been available space on the last page from the previous section.

member.summary: The logical page number of the current page being printed within this section (read-only).
member.value: A 1-based integer representing the logical page number of the current page being printed within this section.

remarks.p: If there are multiple sections within a report this property restarts at 1 within each section.
Note: if property is set to 'Scale' then this property will return the same value as .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSection.LogicalPagePartNumber
member.summary: The logical page part number of the current page being printed within this section (read-only).
member.value: A 1-based integer representing the logical page part number of the current page being printed within this section.

remarks.p: Note: if the logical page is not wide enough to span multiple pages or the property is set to 'Scale' then this property will return 1.

member.summary: A class that exposes settings that relate to a Report.

remarks.p: This class is used to specify settings that determine the way a report will be printed.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Determines if the property needs to be serialized.
member.returns: True if the property should be serialized

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.ResetMargin
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value.

member.summary: Determines if the property needs to be serialized.
member.returns: True if the property should be serialized

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.FileName
member.summary: Returns/sets the name of the file where the report will be saved.

remarks.p: Note: if this property is not set when exporting a report then a default name of Export.xps will be used. If the FileName does not contain a fully qualified path then the will be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.HorizontalPaginationMode
member.summary: Returns/sets the way logical pages are printed when they are too wide to fit on one page.

remarks.p: This property defines how to print a logical page when it is too wide to fit on a single physical page. You can either scale it down so to fits on a single page or split it up over multiple page parts horizontally with the default 'Mosaic' setting.
Note: if 'Scale' is specified then the aspect ratio will be maintained, i.e. the scale factor for the width and height will be the same.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets the margin around the ReportPagePresenter

remarks.p: The margin is the space between page presenter and pages bounds, see .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.PageOrientation
member.summary: Returns/sets the orientation of the page.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.PagePrintOrder
member.summary: Returns/sets the order that pages are printed when HorizontalPaginationMode is set to 'Mosaic'.

remarks.p: When the visual you want to print doesn't fit on a single page, and the is set to "Mosaic", you must decide the order you want to split the visual on the page. There are two way to paginate visual. First print down, then over and second print over, then down.

member.p: When a logical page within a report is too wide to fit and is set to 'Mosaic' then it will be will be split up into multiple page parts horizontally. This property determines the order that the page parts are placed in the report.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.PageRange
member.summary: Returns/sets the range of pages to be included in the report.

remarks.para: If PageTo is zero then the report will go from PageFrom until the end of the report.

member.exception: PageFrom is less than 1 or PageTo is less than 0 or PageTo greater than 0 but less than PageFrom.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.UserPageRangeEnabled
member.summary: Returns/sets whether the standard PrintDialog will allow to user to select a range of pages.

remarks.p: Specifies whether the user will be able so specify whether all the pages or only a limited range will be printed or exported. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.PageSize
member.summary: Returns/sets the size of the page.

remarks.p: Note: normally you wont need to explicitly set the page size since it will be picked up through the PrintDialog and via the optional property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.RepeatType
member.summary: Determines how logical headers within the page content area will be treated within a report section..

remarks.para: Note: In the case of a XamDataGrid this setting determines when field headers are displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Reporting.ReportSettings.PrintQueue
member.summary: Gets or sets a PrintQueue object that represents the target printer.

remarks.p: You supply a object if you prefer not showing the standard .

member.summary: Value converter used to remove mnemonic characters from a string.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.StringWithoutMnemonicsConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a given value to a string that removes '_' characters which would normally be used to identify that the character following be rendered as a mnemonic.
member.param: A string whose text is to be cleared of unescaped '_' characters. Any instances where 2 consecutive '_' exist in the string are replaced with a single '_' character.
The type to which the converter must be convert the value. This parameter is not used. A String value is always returned
This parameter is not used.
The culture to use when calling the .
member.returns: if the parameters do not match the required information. Otherwise a string with any '_' characters removed. If the string contains a sequence of two consecutive '_' characters then a single '_' is left in the string.

member.summary: This method is not implemented for this converter.
member.returns: is always returned.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ResourceWasher
member.summary: The ResourceWasher is a WPF resource dictionary that is used to clone brushes, pens and color resources defined in another source resource dictionary and optional wash their colors. It exposes properties to specify the source resource dictionary, the default wash color along with a collection of wash groups. It also registers 2 attached properties that can be set on a Brush to specify its group name and whether its colors should be washed at all.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ResourceWasher.WashResources
member.summary: Clones and washes the resources from the

remarks.para: Loops thru the source collection (and recursively thru its merged dictionaries) and clones any brushes that are not excluded from the wash via the attached . It washes the cloned resources colors with the appropriate wash color. All other resources are just placed in the collection without cloning them.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ResourceWasher.PerformColorWash(System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Windows.Media.Color,Infragistics.Windows.Themes.WashGroup)
member.summary: Washes a color.
member.param: The starting color.
The color to wash the starting color with.
The associated wash group which may be null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ResourceWasher.AutoWash
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the wash will be triggered automatically.

remarks.para: If true will call the method automatically on ISupportInitialize.EndInit or afterward when any of the , or property values has changed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ResourceWasher.SourceDictionary
member.summary: Gets/sets adictionary that contains the resources to clone.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ResourceWasher.WashColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the default color to use to wash the resources in the SourceDictionary

remarks.para: The color to use to wash any resources not identified to a group in the collection
Note: if this property is left to its default value of Colors.Transparent then any affected resources will not be cloned and washed. Instead they will be copied over without cloning or modification.

member.summary: Gets/sets the method used to wash colors in the resources in the SourceDictionary.

member.summary: Returns a collection of WashGroup objects.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.ToolWindow.ShowDialog(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,Infragistics.Windows.Controls.ToolWindow.ShowDialogCallback)
member.summary: Displays a modally
member.param: The owning element. This element will be used to determine the owner of the window or adorner layer depending upon how the content will be shown.

The callback used to indicate when the dialog has been closed and provide the dialog result. This is needed because the call may not be blocking. For example, when used in an xbap environment, the method will return before the dialog has been closed. In this case, the callback will be called when the dialog is closed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.ToolWindow.OnActivated(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: A that provides data for the event.

remarks.p: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
The OnActivated method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Notes to Inheritors: When overriding OnActivated in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnActivated method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.ToolWindow.Theme
member.summary: Gets/sets the default look for the control.

remarks.para: If left set to null then the default 'Generic' theme will be used. This property can be set to the name of any registered theme (see and methods).

Note: The following themes are pre-registered by this assembly but additional themes can be registered as well.
"Aero" - a theme that is compatible with Vista's 'Aero' theme.
"Generic" - the default theme.
"LunaNormal" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'blue' theme.
"LunaOlive" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'olive' theme.
"LunaSilver" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'silver' theme.
"Office2k7Black" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Black' theme.
"Office2k7Blue" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Blue' theme.
"Office2k7Silver" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Silver' theme.
"Onyx" - a theme that features black and orange highlights.
"Royale" - a theme that features subtle blue highlights.
"RoyaleStrong" - a theme that features strong blue highlights.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Virtualization.RecyclingItemContainerGenerator
member.summary: An alternative generator used by Panels interested in recycling elements.

remarks.para: Note: Using this generator instead of ItemControl's ItemContainerGenerator will require that the derived class implement its own navigation logic. This generator will also not support grouping thru the Items collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Virtualization.RecyclingItemContainerGenerator.BeginGeneration(Infragistics.Windows.Selection.ScrollDirection)
member.summary: Called at the beginning of the generation process.

remarks.para: This method is usually called at the beginnning of a derived class's MeasureOverride logic. This is normally followed by one or more / loops to generate all 'active' containers. Finally, the method is called at the end of the measure logic.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamCarouselListBox
member.summary: A derived control that uses the as its ItemsPanel to arrange items along a user-defined path.

remarks.p: The XamCarouselListBox takes the to the next level. By using the as its ItemsPanel the XamCarouselListBox is able to combine the power and layout flexibility of the with the list management, selection and data binding capabilities of the WPF Selector control. Use this control the same way you would use a with the added benefit of built-in support for the arrangement of list items along a user-defined path.
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamCarouselPanel
member.summary: A derived element that arranges and displays its child elements along a user-defined path, with native support for scrolling and virtualizing those items.

remarks.p: The XamCarouselPanel provides advanced layout capabilties that let you arrange elements along a path of your choosing and apply various parent effects to the items based on their position in the XamCarouselPanel's display area.

Note: Since the XamCarouselPanel is also used by the as its ItemsPanel, all the functionality described here for the XamCarouselPanel also applies to the . While the XamCarouselPanel used by is not directly exposed via a property, the exposes a property of type that lets you control the corresponding settings on the embedded XamCarouselPanel.

The XamCarouselPanel.ViewSettings property exposes a object that lets you tweak numerous settings that control all aspects of layout and presentation, including:
the number of items to display per page ()
the path geometry used to create the path along which items in the list are arranged ()
the various parent effects that can be applied to items as they are displayed at different points along the path (), , , , )
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamCarouselPanel.ItemsPerPageResolved
member.summary: Returns the lesser of the total number of items in the list and the . This is the number used by the to determine the actual number of items per page. (read only)

remarks.p: If the total number of items in the list is less than , the will spread out those items evenly along the so they take up all the space between the prefix and suffix areas. For example, if the number of items per page is set to 10 and the total number of items in the list is 20, this property will return 10 and the 10 displayed items will be arranged along the between the prefix and suffix areas using even spacing. If the number of items in the list is 5, this property will return 5 and those 5 items will be evenly arranged along the between the prefix and suffix areas, but with increased spacing so the entire areas is used. This prevents items from being 'bunched up' at the beginning of the path.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.CarouselListBoxItem
member.summary: derived class used as a container for items in a .

remarks.p: When a is used within a to arrange items in the list, the wraps each of its child items in a CarouselListBoxItem element. The wrapper serves as a convenient place to store state (required by the ) for each of its child items. You will not normally need to interact with this element but you should be aware of its existence in case you have code that needs to traverse the 's parent tree.
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.
Note: An instance of this class is automatically created by the when needed. You do not ordinarily need to create an instance of this class directly.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.EffectStopCollection`1
member.summary: Abstract base class for all collections.

remarks.p: All EffectStopCollections are derived from this abstract generic base class which provides implementations for functionality required by all derived effect-specific classes. Refer to the documentation for for a full discussion of how to use EffectStops to apply parent effects to items in a

There are 5 supported effect stop types for this abstract base generic collection:
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply Opacity effects to items.
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply Scaling effects to items.
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply Skewing effects about the X-axis to items.
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply Skewing effects about the Y-axis to items.
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply ZOrder effects to items to control their positions in the Z-space.
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.

member.typeparam: The type for which the EffectStopCollection is being created.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the EffectStopCollection.

remarks.p: The object automatically creates an instance of this class when necessary. You do not ordinarily need to create an instance of this class directly.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.EffectStop
member.summary: Abstract base class that represents an and contains an Offset and a Value.

remarks.p:
There are 5 specific effect stop types derived from this base class:
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply Opacity effects to items.
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply Scaling effects to items.
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply Skewing effects along the X-axis to items.
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply Skewing effects along the Y-axis to items.
- Defines an EffectStop used to apply ZOrder effects to items to control their positions in the Z-space.

An EffectStop contains an Offset and a Value which define how a particular parent effect is applied to items in the The supports 5 parent effects the: Opacity, Scaling, Skewing along the X-axis, Skewing along the Y-Axis and ZOrder. Each of the 5 effects has a corresponding EffectStop-derived class that defines an offset and value for applying that effect.
You can define 1 or more EffectStops for each parent effect by creating the appropriate derived EffectStop (e.g., ) and adding it to the appropriate derived EffectStopCollection (e.g., ).
The 5 effect stop collections are exposed as properties on the object (, , , , ). The object is exposed via the ViewSettings properties on both the . and ..

When applying a parent effect to an item in the list, the XamCarouselPanel considers 4 pieces of information. For example, when the XamCarouselPanel is deciding how to apply an Opacity effect to an item it considers the following 4 pieces of information:
The setting of the property to determine if opacity effects are being used. You can use this property to turn Opacity effects on or off. If this property is set to false, the stops its evaluation and does not apply an opacity effect to the item.
The list of that have been defined. The uses linear interpolation to establish Values for Offsets that fall between defined stops.
The value of the property which determines how the '' of each is evaluated. For example, if the is set to .UseItemPath, and the item's position is 50 percent along the , the applied to the item's Opacity would be based on an offset of .5. If however, the is set to .Vertical, and the item's Y-position in the 's display area is one third of the way down from the top of the 's display area, the value applied to the item's Opacity would be based on an offset of .3.
The position of the item in the 's display area (used as described in the previous bullet).
The other types of parent effects are evaluated in exactly the same way using correspondingly named properties on the object.
By applying different combinations of s you can achieve some interesting layout effects in the .
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.

member.summary: Compares the specified object to this instance.
member.param: The object to compare to this instance
member.returns: A signed number that indicates the relative values of the instance and the specified object. If this instance is less than the specified object a number less than zero is returned. If this instance is the same as the specified object then zero is returned. If this instance is greater than the specified object -or- the specified object is a null reference a number greater than zero is returned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.EffectStop.Offset
member.summary: A value between 0 and 1 that represents the percentage offset into the overall range for the effect.

remarks.p: The overall range for the effect is determined by the setting of the related property and the extent of the corresponding control dimension. For example, the overall range for an is determined by the setting of the property and the corresponding extent of the 's display area. So if the is set to .Vertical the overall range for the effect would be the height of the 's display area. If the Offset of the EffectStop is set to .75 then the EffectStop's Value would apply to items whose vertical position in the 's display area is three quarters of the way down from the top (.Vertical is always evaluated from the top down)
A similar evaluation is done with respect to the control's horizontal extent if the is set to .Horizontal, with evaluation of the Offset done from left to right.
The example provided above for an applies to the EffectStop types as well.
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.EffectStop.Value
member.summary: The value that should be applied at the associated with this .

remarks.p: Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.
Note: The range of valid values for this property depends on the derived EffectStop type.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.OpacityEffectStop
member.summary: A strongly typed used for Opacity effects. Refer to the documentation for for a full discussion of how to use EffectStops to apply parent effects to items in a .

remarks.p: Opacity effects give you control over the opacity of items within the based on their position in the 's display area. For example, you can use an Opacity effect in conjunction with a Scaling effect to simulate perspective and make items appear to be fading into the distance.
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.
Note: This derived class provides range validation for the property. The valid range for an OpacityEffectStop Value is from 0 to 1.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.ScalingEffectStop
member.summary: A strongly typed used for Scaling effects. Refer to the documentation for for a full discussion of how to use EffectStops to apply parent effects to items in a .

remarks.p: Scaling effects give you control over the size of items within the based on their position in the 's display area. For example, you can use a Scaling effect in conjunction with an Opacity effect to simulate perspective and make items appear to be fading into the distance.
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.
Note: This derived class provides range validation for the property. The valid range for a ScalingEffectStop Value is from 0 and 10.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.ZOrderEffectStop
member.summary: A strongly typed used for ZOrder effects. Refer to the documentation for for a full discussion of how to use EffectStops to apply parent effects to items in a .

remarks.p: ZOrder effects give you control over the z-index of items based on their position in the 's display area. For example, you can use a ZOrder effect for items on a circular path to ensure that items at the bottom of the circle (i.e., logically closer to the viewer's eye) are topmost, with items to the right and left further down in the zorder.
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.
Note: This derived class provides range validation for the property. The valid range for a ZOrderEffectStop Value is from 0 to 1 (with 0 representing 'bottommost' and 1 representing 'topmost')

member.summary: A strongly typed used for effects that Skew items about the X-axis. Refer to the documentation for for a full discussion of how to use EffectStops to apply parent effects to items in a .

remarks.p: Skewing effects give you control over the rotation of items about their X or Y axis, based on their position in the 's display area. For example, you can use a Skewing effects with a curved path to make items appear to be wrapping around the curve.
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.
Note: This derived class provides range validation for the property. The valid range for a SkewAngleXEffectStop Value is from -360 to +360.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.CarouselPanelNavigator
member.summary: Control that provides a UI for scrolling items in a .

remarks.p: The CarouselPanelNavigator displays buttons that execute when clicked, in order to scroll items. If you want to provide your own UI for scrollig items, you can hide the CarouselPanelNavigator by setting the CarouselViewSettings' property to hidden and then creating a UI that executes the same scrolling commands used by the navigator.

The object exposes a property that can be used to style the control. Alternatively, you can create a style that targets the CarouselPanelNavigator and place it in a resource dictionary somewhere in the ancestor chain of the control.
Refer to the Carousel Architecture Overview topic in the Developer's Guide for an explanation of how Carousel presentation works.
Note: The object is available via the 's and 's properties.
Note: An instance of this class is automatically created by the when needed. You do not ordinarily need to create an instance of this class directly.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager
member.summary: Static class used for registering resources based on theme and grouping

remarks.para: Themes are identified by name (e.g. Onyx, Aero, Royale etc.)
Groupings are also identified by name (e.g. Editors, Primitives, DataPresenter etc.).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.ThemeChangedEvent
member.summary: Routed event for raising a notification when the has been changed.

remarks.p: An element must raise this event when its Theme property has been changed. This is normally done within the PropertyChangedCallback added by overriding the metadata for the ThemeProperty.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.ThemeProperty
member.summary: Identifies the Theme attached dependency property

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.GetTheme(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the value of the 'Theme' attached property

remarks.para: If left set to null then the default 'Generic' theme will be used. This property can be set to the name of any registered theme (see and methods).

Note: The following themes are pre-registered by this assembly but additional themes can be registered as well.
"Aero" - a theme that is compatible with Vista's 'Aero' theme.
"Generic" - the default theme.
"LunaNormal" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'blue' theme.
"LunaOlive" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'olive' theme.
"LunaSilver" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'silver' theme.
"Office2k7Black" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Black' theme.
"Office2k7Blue" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Blue' theme.
"Office2k7Silver" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Silver' theme.
"Onyx" - a theme that features black and orange highlights.
"Royale" - a theme that features subtle blue highlights.
"RoyaleStrong" - a theme that features strong blue highlights.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.SetTheme(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of the 'Theme' attached property

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.GetGroupingsForType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the registered groupings for the specified type
member.param: The type whose groupings are to be returned.
member.returns: An array of the registered groupings for the type or its base type if it has been registered; null if no groupings have been registered for the element.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.GetGroupingsForTypeImpl(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the registered groupings for the specified type
member.param: The type whose groupings are to be returned.
member.returns: An array of the registered groupings for the type or its base type if it has been registered; null if no groupings have been registered for the element.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.GetGroupingsForTheme(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of all registered groupings for a specific theme
member.param: The specified theme.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.GetResourceSet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a ResourceDictionary containing resources for a specific theme and grouping
member.param: The name of the theme (e.g. Onyx, Aero, Royale etc.)
The name of the grouping (e.g. Editors, Primitives, DataPresenter etc.)
member.returns: The Resourcedictioanry containing the associated styles or null if not registered.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.GetThemes
member.summary: Returns a list of all registered themes

member.summary: Returns a list of all registered themes
member.param: A boolean indicating whether to include the default theme

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.GetThemes(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of all registered themes
member.param: A boolean indicating whether to include the default theme
The name of the grouping which must be registered for a theme in order to be returned.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Selection.ISelectionHost.EnterSnakingMode(Infragistics.Windows.Selection.ISelectableItem)
member.summary: Used to tell the host to enter snaking mode if appropriate for the item type being selected.
member.remarks: Snaking refers to range selection where the items being selected form a snaking pattern instead of a rectangular pattern. For eample, if in a grid that contained 5 columns the user was selecting a range of cells from different rows, the selection could be either rectangular or snake from row to row in which case all cells from intervening rows would get selected.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Selection.SelectionStrategySingle.AllowToggle
member.summary: Gets/sets whether toggling of the selected state of an item is allowed

remarks.para: If AllowToggle is to true then holding down the 'Ctrl' key while clicking on a selectable item will toggle its selection state. The same behavior applies when holding the 'Ctrl' key down and using the keyboard to select/deselect the item.

For example, holding the 'Ctrl' key down and pressing the space bar while focus is within a XamDataGrid (with its FieldLayoutSettings.SelectionTypeRecord set to 'Single') will toggle the selection state of its ActiveRecord assuming there is no ActiveCell.

member.value: True if toggling is allowed, otherwise false. The default is true.

member.summary: Returns whether selection should be modified when the cursor passes over a different item than the selected one. The default implementation returns true.

An enumeration indicating which corners will be rounded

A double that indicates the vertical radius of the corners

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Utilities.StripMnemonics(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Strips mnemonics from a string.
member.param: A string that may contain one or more mnemonic characters.

True if any subsequent mnemonics should be escaped (if not already escaped by a preceeding '_'). This should be true if this will be assigned to an AccessText element (or a ContentPresenter whose RecognizesAccessKey is true) so that no character will be rendered as a mnemonic. This should be false to provide the behavior where the text appears as it would in an AccessText when the underline under the leading mnemonic is not rendered.
member.returns: A new string with those mnemonics stripped out or the passed in string if it didn't contain any.
member.remarks: A mnemonic, or accelerator, character is defined as a character that has a single underscore ('_') preceding it.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Utilities.PointFromScreenSafe(System.Windows.Media.Visual,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Translates a point in screen coordinates into coordinates relative to an element
member.param: The specified element
The point in screen coordinates.
member.returns: The point translated into coordinates relative to the element.

remarks.para: Note: In an XBAP application we don't have access rights to call PointFromScreen. In this situation we walk up the visual tree to the top level element and map the point from it.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Utilities.PointFromScreenSafe(System.Windows.Media.Visual,System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Media.Visual)
member.summary: Translates a point in screen coordinates into coordinates relative to an element
member.param: The specified element
The point in screen coordinates.
An optional second element to reference.
member.returns: The point translated into coordinates relative to the element.

remarks.para: Note: In an XBAP application we don't have access rights to call PointFromScreen. In this situation we look at the refElement, if not null we get the common ancestor element and map the point from it. If refElement is null then we walk up the visual tree to the top level element and map the point from it.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Utilities.SnapElementToDevicePixelsProperty
member.summary: SnapElementToDevicePixels Attached Dependency Property

remarks.p: The SnapsElementToDevicePixels is meant to be used on elements such as an Image that does not currently support SnapsToDevicePixels.

Note: The RenderTransform of the element is used so you should not set the RenderTransform on the same element on which you are setting SnapElementToDevicePixels to true. You may set the RenderTransform on an ancestor element. Also, you should not set this property on an element that is an ancestor of one or more elements that have this property set to true. In such a case the results are undefined since the child element's RenderTransform could be calculated before that of the ancestor element. Since this property should be set on discrete elements such as an Image, this scenario should not be required.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip
member.summary: The XamScreenTip is derived from the WPF ToolTip class and adds the notion of and to the standard ToolTip.

remarks.p: The header area appears at the top of the tooltip (its content provided by the property) and the footer area appears at the bottom of the tooltip (its content provided by the property). In between the and areas is the main tooltip area, with its content provided by the base ToolTip classs Content property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip.Footer
member.summary: Returns/sets the content for the footer area of the XamScreenTip. The default is null.

remarks.p: The footer area appears at the bottom of the tooltip below the main tooltip content. If set to null, no footer is displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip.FooterSeparatorVisibility
member.summary: Returns/sets the Visibility of the separator which divides the footer area from the main content. The default is Visibility.Visible.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Returns/sets the data template used to display the content. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip.FooterTemplateSelector
member.summary: Returns/sets the data template selector to provide customer template selection logic for the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip.Header
member.summary: Returns/sets the content for the header area of the XamScreenTip. The default is null.

remarks.p: The header area appears at the bottom of the tooltip below the main tooltip content. If set to null, no header is displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip.HeaderSeparatorVisibility
member.summary: Returns/sets the Visibility of the separator which divides the header area from the main content. The default is Visibility.Collapsed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Returns/sets the data template used to display the content. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip.HeaderTemplateSelector
member.summary: Returns/sets the data template selector to provide customer template selection logic for the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamScreenTip.Theme
member.summary: Gets/sets the default look for the control.

remarks.para: If left set to null then the default 'Generic' theme will be used. This property can be set to the name of any registered theme (see and methods).

Note: The following themes are pre-registered by this assembly but additional themes can be registered as well.
"Aero" - a theme that is compatible with Vista's 'Aero' theme.
"Generic" - the default theme.
"LunaNormal" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'blue' theme.
"LunaOlive" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'olive' theme.
"LunaSilver" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'silver' theme.
"Office2k7Black" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Black' theme.
"Office2k7Blue" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Blue' theme.
"Office2k7Silver" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Silver' theme.
"Onyx" - a theme that features black and orange highlights.
"Royale" - a theme that features subtle blue highlights.
"RoyaleStrong" - a theme that features strong blue highlights.

member.summary: Occurs when the 'Theme' property changes

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamTabControl.MaximumTabRows
member.summary: Determines the maximum number of tab rows that will be displayed before a vertical scrollbar will appear.

remarks.para: The property can only be set to a positive integer. It defaults to 3.
Note: This property is ignored if the property is not set to one of the 'Multi...' layouts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Controls.XamTabControl.Theme
member.summary: Gets/sets the default look for the control.

remarks.para: If left set to null then the default 'Generic' theme will be used. This property can be set to the name of any registered theme (see and methods).

The following themes are pre-registered by this assembly but additional themes can be registered as well.
"Aero" - a theme that is compatible with Vista's 'Aero' theme.
"Generic" - the default theme.
"LunaNormal" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'blue' theme.
"LunaOlive" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'olive' theme.
"LunaSilver" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'silver' theme.
"Office2k7Black" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Black' theme.
"Office2k7Blue" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Blue' theme.
"Office2k7Silver" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Silver' theme.
"Onyx" - a theme that features black and orange highlights.
"Royale" - a theme that features subtle blue highlights.
"RoyaleStrong" - a theme that features strong blue highlights.
